verses.text_plain: Then the Lord said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the Lord God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.verse_html: 1Then the Lord said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the Lord God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.

verses.text_plain: For if thou refuse to let them go, and wilt hold them still,
verses.verse_html: 2For if thou refuse to let them go, and wilt hold them still,

verses.text_plain: Behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thy cattle which is in the field, upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the oxen, and upon the sheep: there shall be a very grievous murrain.
verses.verse_html: 3Behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thy cattle which is in the field, upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the oxen, and upon the sheep: there shall be a very grievous murrain.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord shall sever between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt: and there shall nothing die of all that is the children’s of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 4And the Lord shall sever between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt: and there shall nothing die of all that is the children’s of Israel.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord appointed a set time, saying, To morrow the Lord shall do this thing in the land.
verses.verse_html: 5And the Lord appointed a set time, saying, To morrow the Lord shall do this thing in the land.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord did that thing on the morrow, and all the cattle of Egypt died: but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one.
verses.verse_html: 6And the Lord did that thing on the morrow, and all the cattle of Egypt died: but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one.

verses.text_plain: And Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not let the people go.
verses.verse_html: 7And Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not let the people go.

tokens.text: and, behold, there was not one
and he did not let the people

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said unto Moses and unto Aaron, Take to you handfuls of ashes of the furnace, and let Moses sprinkle it toward the heaven in the sight of Pharaoh.
verses.verse_html: 8And the Lord said unto Moses and unto Aaron, Take to you handfuls of ashes of the furnace, and let Moses sprinkle it toward the heaven in the sight of Pharaoh.

verses.text_plain: And it shall become small dust in all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking forth with blains upon man, and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.verse_html: 9And it shall become small dust in all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking forth with blains upon man, and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.

tokens.text: And it shall become small dust

verses.text_plain: And they took ashes of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses sprinkled it up toward heaven; and it became a boil breaking forth with blains upon man, and upon beast.
verses.verse_html: 10And they took ashes of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses sprinkled it up toward heaven; and it became a boil breaking forth with blains upon man, and upon beast.

verses.text_plain: And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boil was upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians.
verses.verse_html: 11And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boil was upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them; as the Lord had spoken unto Moses.
verses.verse_html: 12And the Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them; as the Lord had spoken unto Moses.

tokens.text: not unto them; as the Lord

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith the Lord God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.verse_html: 13And the Lord said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith the Lord God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.

verses.text_plain: For I will at this time send all my plagues upon thine heart, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people; that thou mayest know that there is none like me in all the earth.
verses.verse_html: 14For I will at this time send all my plagues upon thine heart, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people; that thou mayest know that there is none like me in all the earth.

tokens.text: For I will at this time
none like me in all the earth

verses.text_plain: For now I will stretch out my hand, that I may smite thee and thy people with pestilence; and thou shalt be cut off from the earth.
verses.verse_html: 15For now I will stretch out my hand, that I may smite thee and thy people with pestilence; and thou shalt be cut off from the earth.

tokens.text: For now I will stretch out
and thou shalt be cut off

verses.text_plain: And in very deed for this cause have I raised thee up, for to shew in thee my power; and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth.
verses.verse_html:
16And in very deed for this cause have I raised thee up, for to shew in thee my power; and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth. ▼
▼ raised…: Heb. made thee stand

footnotes.body_html: ▼ raised…: Heb. made thee stand

verses.text_plain: As yet exaltest thou thyself against my people, that thou wilt not let them go?
verses.verse_html: 17As yet exaltest thou thyself against my people, that thou wilt not let them go?

tokens.text: that thou wilt not let them go

verses.text_plain: Behold, to morrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as hath not been in Egypt since the foundation thereof even until now.
verses.verse_html: 18Behold, to morrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as hath not been in Egypt since the foundation thereof even until now.

tokens.text: I will cause it to rain

verses.text_plain: Send therefore now, and gather thy cattle, and all that thou hast in the field; for upon every man and beast which shall be found in the field, and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.
verses.verse_html: 19Send therefore now, and gather thy cattle, and all that thou hast in the field; for upon every man and beast which shall be found in the field, and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.

tokens.text: and all that thou hast in the field
upon them, and they shall die

verses.text_plain: He that feared the word of the Lord among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses:
verses.verse_html: 20He that feared the word of the Lord among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses:

verses.text_plain: And he that regarded not the word of the Lord left his servants and his cattle in the field.
verses.verse_html:
21And he that regarded not the word of the Lord left his servants and his cattle in the field. ▼
▼ regarded…: Heb. set not his heart unto

footnotes.body_text: ▼ regarded…: Heb. set not his heart unto
footnotes.body_html: ▼ regarded…: Heb. set not his heart unto

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said unto Moses, Stretch forth thine hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man, and upon beast, and upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.
verses.verse_html: 22And the Lord said unto Moses, Stretch forth thine hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man, and upon beast, and upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.

verses.text_plain: And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven: and the Lord sent thunder and hail, and the fire ran along upon the ground; and the Lord rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
verses.verse_html: 23And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven: and the Lord sent thunder and hail, and the fire ran along upon the ground; and the Lord rained hail upon the land of Egypt.

verses.text_plain: So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail, very grievous, such as there was none like it in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
verses.verse_html: 24So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail, very grievous, such as there was none like it in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.

tokens.text: like it in all the land

verses.text_plain: And the hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and beast; and the hail smote every herb of the field, and brake every tree of the field.
verses.verse_html: 25And the hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and beast; and the hail smote every herb of the field, and brake every tree of the field.

verses.text_plain: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, was there no hail.
verses.verse_html: 26Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, was there no hail.

verses.text_plain: And Pharaoh sent, and called for Moses and Aaron, and said unto them, I have sinned this time: the Lord is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
verses.verse_html: 27And Pharaoh sent, and called for Moses and Aaron, and said unto them, I have sinned this time: the Lord is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.

verses.text_plain: Intreat the Lord (for it is enough) that there be no more mighty thunderings and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no longer.
verses.verse_html:
28Intreat the Lord (for it is enough) that there be no more mighty thunderings and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no longer. ▼
▼ mighty…: Heb. voices of God

tokens.text: and I will let you go

footnotes.body_html: ▼ mighty…: Heb. voices of God

verses.text_plain: And Moses said unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread abroad my hands unto the Lord; and the thunder shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that thou mayest know how that the earth is the Lord’s.
verses.verse_html: 29And Moses said unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread abroad my hands unto the Lord; and the thunder shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that thou mayest know how that the earth is the Lord’s.

tokens.text: unto him, As soon as I am gone out
neither shall there be any more hail

verses.text_plain: But as for thee and thy servants, I know that ye will not yet fear the Lord God.
verses.verse_html: 30But as for thee and thy servants, I know that ye will not yet fear the Lord God.

tokens.text: But as for thee and thy servants
that ye will not yet fear

verses.text_plain: And the flax and the barley was smitten: for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was bolled.
verses.verse_html: 31And the flax and the barley was smitten: for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was bolled.

verses.text_plain: But the wheat and the rie were not smitten: for they were not grown up.
verses.verse_html:
32But the wheat and the rie were not smitten: for they were not grown up. ▼
▼ not grown…: Heb. hidden or, dark

footnotes.body_text: ▼ not grown…: Heb. hidden or, dark
footnotes.body_html: ▼ not grown…: Heb. hidden or, dark

verses.text_plain: And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread abroad his hands unto the Lord: and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth.
verses.verse_html: 33And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread abroad his hands unto the Lord: and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth.

verses.text_plain: And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, he sinned yet more, and hardened his heart, he and his servants.
verses.verse_html: 34And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, he sinned yet more, and hardened his heart, he and his servants.

verses.text_plain: And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, neither would he let the children of Israel go; as the Lord had spoken by Moses.
verses.verse_html:
35And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, neither would he let the children of Israel go; as the Lord had spoken by Moses. ▼
▼ by Moses: Heb. by the hand of Moses

tokens.text: neither would he let the children

footnotes.body_text: ▼ by Moses: Heb. by the hand of Moses
footnotes.body_html: ▼ by Moses: Heb. by the hand of Moses
